intro: Crotalaria pohliana f. intermedia, commonly known as the intermediate crotalaria, is a flowering plant belonging to the Fabaceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and trifoliate leaves, which are typical of the genus Crotalaria. The plant is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and thrives in well-drained soils. It is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fallow fields. Its botanical features make it both ecologically significant and potentially invasive in certain environments.
